review_text: I’ve been wanting to stay in a tiny house for some time now. Brett’s place was indeed tiny but super cute. Upon arrival we had an unexpected welcome party of about 15-20 ladybugs inside, no fault of Brett. He offered to come right over & take care of them but we were able to use the vacuum provided to do a catch & release ourselves! We were not quite prepared for the paintball complex at the end of the gravel path near the home. So there was some noise from that & quite a bit of dust kicked up from the cars. But after closing time all was quiet. The shower was very small (think tiny house!) & the water pressure was really low. There was only one bath towel provided but we did have two wash cloths & a hand towel. There was coffee & essentials provided plus bottled water & some apples in the fridge. I can’t say a whole lot about the bed, just a mattress on the floor of the loft. Overall it was a neat overnight experience.

If nature isn’t for you, I’d still highly recommend! Inside Tiny Blue is comfy and cute! Hop in your car and you’re 3 minutes from a gas station and 5 minutes from the bigger stores and restaurants.
We got the pleasure of touring the Tiny Homes that Brett is currently building, as well as the neighboring paint ball field (of which we never heard a noise from, which wouldn’t have bothered us a bit, but was still very nice!)
I could go on and on about the absolute pleasure we had staying here, and will definitely be back to stay again! Brett and Heather, thank you so much!

We had the perfect wedding and the best weekend of our lives. We can not thank Jeff and Betsy enough. We never had an issue during our stay but had confidence knowing they were only a call away. We hope to rent this property again for more family/friend get togethers in the future.

Our stay with Rick and Donna was outstanding!
My family lives throughout Stanley County and until this year we had always stayed in a guestroom of my cousins house. Well our guest room has been turned into a nursery for the sweetest little blessing- which meant we were sleeping on the floor or we needed to find a good place to stay.
Enter Rick and Donna's place! What a find!
From the moment I contacted/booked with Rick and we received an email back, I KNEW this was the place for us. Rick was so helpful, personable, receptive and welcoming.
The suite is B-E-A-U-T-I-F-U-L! Lovely decor, very inviting and relaxing. The bed and pillows are so incredibly comfortable that each night we were asleep within moments of our heads hitting the pillows.
The bathroom is enormous with double sinks, a vanity where I could sit and do my hair and makeup as well as a lovely jetted shower and large sunken jet tub (which I didn't get a chance to use but maybe next time!)
I was impressed with their walk-in closet which held extra linens and bedding as well as an iron and an ironing board and a full length mirror. I also noticed that the house was so quiet you couldn't tell anyone else was even there; it was really its own private suite!
Rick and Donna have a Keurig machine and a miniature refrigerator and each morning we would have some fruit and some coffee before hitting the road for our jam packed days with our family.
It was so nice to know that at the end of each day we were going back to a spotless, safe, quiet, inviting home to rest and recharge.
Our ONLY Complaint is that we could not stay longer.
We cannot wait to go back and have already started to make tentative plans for September. This is for sure our new "home away from home" when we are in the area.
P.S. We got to meet Chewy the goat who is super sweet and talkative and likes his head scratched - just mind the wire fence!
